alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 6:24AM EST until January 02 at 9:08PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. .The river has crested at Booneville and will continue to fall. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EST Sunday the stage was 30.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM EST Sunday was 32.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 30.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.2 feet on 02/16/1970. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 9 am EST
